Issues.Title: fix(types): relax the return type of props default option
Issues.Body:
<!--
Please make sure to read the Pull Request Guidelines:
https://github.com/vuejs/vue/blob/dev/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#pull-request-guidelines
-->

<!-- PULL REQUEST TEMPLATE -->
<!-- (Update "[ ]" to "[x]" to check a box) -->

**What kind of change does this PR introduce?** (check at least one)

- [x] Bugfix
- [ ] Feature
- [ ] Code style update
- [ ] Refactor
- [ ] Build-related changes
- [ ] Other, please describe:

**Does this PR introduce a breaking change?** (check one)

- [ ] Yes
- [x] No

**The PR fulfills these requirements:**

- [x] It's submitted to the `dev` branch for v2.x (or to a previous version branch), _not_ the `master` branch
- [x] All tests are passing: https://github.com/vuejs/vue/blob/dev/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#development-setup
- [x] New/updated tests are included

**Other information:**

Currently, the return type of `default` option is annotated with `object` since it is used for generating fresh object for each component instance. But there is another use case for `default` option of function in [portal-vue](https://github.com/LinusBorg/portal-vue) which is for dynamically generating unique value as default.
https://github.com/LinusBorg/portal-vue/blob/develop/src/components/portal.js#L16

The current typing breaks `this` type inference when the `default` function returns non-object type. I just relaxed the return type to `any` to avoid breaking the inference.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(types): relax the return type of props default option" (#8537)

Issues.Title: The logic of Vue.set is unreasonable when handling array
Issues.Body:
### Version
2.5.17-beta.0

### Reproduction link
[https://jsfiddle.net/L6pey1ts/22/](https://jsfiddle.net/L6pey1ts/22/)

### Steps to reproduce
Run JSFiddle snippet

### What is expected?
I expect, that the program only outputs `2,3,5,7,11,13` (when executing `arr.push(13)`).

### What is actually happening?
```
    (empty line)
2,3,5,7,11
arr.abc changed
arr.def
    (empty line)
2,3,5,7,11,13
    (empty line)
arr.def changed
```

---
**abc** is already existed on **arr** when **app** is initializing, and it is neglected for it was defined on an array.

**def** is set by **Vue.set()**, but it executes **defineReactive(arr, 'def', 'arr.def')** (src/core/observer/index.js  line:225), and notifies the watchers.

Vue.set() should be consistent when dealing with them. In my mind, both of them should be neglected.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "The logic of Vue.set is unreasonable when handling array" (#8535)

Issues.Title: Why not $payload?
Issues.Body:
### What problem does this feature solve?
Hello folks, How it going?

I want to start a discussion about parameter $event, when we use Custom Events to notify parent component about children changes, instead receive $ event we can receive $ payload, yes it's just semantic, but IMHO I think the $ payload name make much sense.


### What does the proposed API look like?
```
@:custom-event="text = $payload"
```

or
 
```
@:custom-event="drawSVG($payload)"
```

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Why not $payload?" (#8533)

Issues.Title: Passing a value attribute via to a select tag using $attrs should not set the select value without v-model
Issues.Body:
### Version
2.5.16

### Reproduction link
[https://codepen.io/lee-chase/pen/cead98e32ada57abc99350be8331197f](https://codepen.io/lee-chase/pen/cead98e32ada57abc99350be8331197f)

### Steps to reproduce
Can be observed on opening the codepen.

### What is expected?
Passing a value to a select tag via $attrs should behave the same way setting the attribute in HTML does, that is it is ignored.

When using v-model it should behave as it currently does.

### What is actually happening?
The value overrides any selected attribute set on an option. This should only occur with v-model.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Passing a value attribute via to a select tag using $attrs should not set the select value without v-model" (#8532)

Issues.Title: Crash when use v-bind with v-model on input element
Issues.Body:
### Version
2.5.16

### Reproduction link
[http://jsfiddle.net/eywraw8t/190868/](http://jsfiddle.net/eywraw8t/190868/)

### Steps to reproduce
Bind undefined attributes prop on input element with v-model 

<input v-bind="attributes" v-model="editingValue">

### What is expected?
Input element uses default "text" value for "type" attribute.

It works on vue 2.5.13

### What is actually happening?
Exception:

VM841 vue.js:1743 TypeError: Cannot read property 'type' of undefined
    at Proxy.eval (eval at createFunction (VM841 vue.js:10667), <anonymous>:3:116)
    at Vue._render (VM841 vue.js:4535)
    at Vue.updateComponent (VM841 vue.js:2788)
    at Watcher.get (VM841 vue.js:3140)
    at new Watcher (VM841 vue.js:3129)
    at mountComponent (VM841 vue.js:2795)
    at Vue.$mount (VM841 vue.js:8527)
    at Vue.$mount (VM841 vue.js:10926)
    at Vue._init (VM841 vue.js:4627)
    at new Vue (VM841 vue.js:4716)

---
It works when you: 

1. Add type attribute on input element
<input type="text" v-bind="attributes" v-model="editingValue">

2. Return empty object for attributes property by default
...
props: {
  	attributes: {default: function() {return {}}} 
  }
...

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Crash when use v-bind with v-model on input element" (#8531)

Issues.Title: [Suggestion] Regarding issues in Chinese
Issues.Body:
I know this is probably not the place for this but i don't know where else to reach you, 
i'd like to suggest that you try to tell Chinese users to try and report issues in English if and whenever they can, because a lot of people in my current company and others i know of are shutting down Vue proposals on account of not being able to understand bug tickets made for VueJS and the fact many popular libraries are primarily and/or exclusively in Chinese.

It's important for VueJS to have a healthy Chinese community but i feel that the community's disregard for non-Chinese users is ultimately damaging VueJS and frustrating the efforts of Vue evangelists in the west. Couple the non-english documentation and issues with React's facebook backing and it's very hard to convince anyone in management that Vue is the way to go, i feel that i'm not alone and would also like to hear what others have to say about it.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Suggestion] Regarding issues in Chinese " (#8525)

Issues.Title: Instantiating new array inside renderList()
Issues.Body:
### Version
2.5.13

### Reproduction link
[https://github.com/vuejs/vue/blob/5981529b497f5ef064b123aeb58eb9655172d6eb/src/core/instance/render-helpers/render-list.js](https://github.com/vuejs/vue/blob/5981529b497f5ef064b123aeb58eb9655172d6eb/src/core/instance/render-helpers/render-list.js)

### Steps to reproduce
When renderList(val, render) is called, passing NaN for 'val' as parameter.

Apologies for the "Reproduction link", but we cannot reproduce one since we have no clue what triggered that function:
https://github.com/vuejs/vue/blob/5981529b497f5ef064b123aeb58eb9655172d6eb/src/core/instance/render-helpers/render-list.js
on line 22.
But you can probably do a unit test using renderList(0/0, function(a, b) {})

### What is expected?
unable to instantiate new array

### What is actually happening?
code is not checking if given 'val' is NaN, which is a 'number'.  Thus trying to call new Array(NaN) throws exception

---
probably can check if the given val is greater or equal to 0 since if a negative value will also cause exception: new Array(-1)

instead of:
... else if (typeof val === 'number') {

}

use:
... else if (typeof val === 'number' && val >= 0) {

}

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Instantiating new array inside renderList()" (#8511)

Issues.Title: aliasing component "props" names
Issues.Body:
### What problem does this feature solve?
similar to angularjs directives, would like the ability to alias the names the component's parent uses to pass values 


### What does the proposed API look like?
component:
```
export default {
		name: "paging",
		props: {
			"count": {"name": "pagingCount", "type": Number}
		},

```


parent:
```
<paging v-bind:paging-count="itemsCount"></paging>
```

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "aliasing component "props" names" (#8522)

Issues.Title: Manually executing of a directive expression
Issues.Body:
### What problem does this feature solve?
Let's assume  I have a custom directive which will be used like this: `v-my-directive:someargument.amodifier`.

Now I have JavaScript code as value like this:  `v-my-directive:someargument.amodifier="alert('Hello Vue!')"`.

The problem is, the value would be executed. How can I prevent this and execute it by myself, like `v-on` it does?

### What does the proposed API look like?
Maybe adding an option to the `Vue.directive` function would be helpful. Example:

```js
Vue.directive('my-directive', {
    parsing: false, // Default would be true
});
```

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Manually executing of a directive expression" (#8517)

Issues.Title: $listeners are not updated if you use $on
Issues.Body:
### Version
2.5.16

### Reproduction link
[http://jsfiddle.net/eywraw8t/182246/](http://jsfiddle.net/eywraw8t/182246/)

### Steps to reproduce
Open fiddle and click on the text.

There is one component in the middle of 2 others that forwards events like the documentation example, with `v-on="$events"`. The `<h1>` component fires a mousedown and a mouseup, and the highest-level component registers one of those in the render function and one of them with `$on`.

### What is expected?
I would expect using `$on` to update `$listeners` which would update the listeners on the deepest component. If this is by design, could it be clarified in the documentation?

### What is actually happening?
`$on` doesn't update child components if `$listeners` is used in the render functions

---
I know it's unusual to use `$on` like this, but I'm working on an Angular application that's being slowly converted into Vue. In order to cross barriers we create Vue components and mount them into Angular directly

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "$listeners are not updated if you use $on" (#8515)

Issues.Title: Prevent Vue Router from accessing the history object when using hash mode
Issues.Body:
### What problem does this feature solve?
The feature request is simple: Vue Router should not access `history` at all when it starts in hash mode.

**But Why?**

The problem is that Chrome web apps (as in apps installed from the Chrome Web Store to Chrome OS devices) do not have access to the same browser API a regular web app has. In this particular case the problem is that the `history` object is not present.

This was not really a problem before, `history` was `undefined` and it didn't really matter. The current behavior is different. When an app tries to access the `history` object it completely crashes. A polyfill cannot be implemented either because of this.

It would seem the solution to this problem should be simply to stick to hash mode, but Vue Router still tries to access `history` even in hash mode. I imagine this is done to check whether the history API is present, but since hash mode is already specified, those checks are unnecessary.

A couple of months ago I hacked my way through this by modifying Vue Router. If there is interest I could implement this feature myself.

Even if this feature is not implemented the Vue team should at least be aware of this limitation.

### What does the proposed API look like?
No changes in the API would be necessary.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Prevent Vue Router from accessing the history object when using hash mode" (#2304)

### Version

1. open console
2. click `/home`
3. click `Info`
4. click `/foo`

The props still being "there" and no warning about the missing required prop.

The props are apparently removed/emptied and vue throws a warning.

---
It's a combination of several circumstances:

2. props needs to be required on the component
3. prop needs to be on the children, it does work on the parent:
  - click `/home`
  - click `/foo`

Issues.Title: Mute/Turn off <router-view> reactive rendering programatically
Issues.Body:
### What problem does this feature solve?
Suppose an app like `Settings` app in iOS.

We navigate in a path like this: 
Settings -> General -> About This Phone

Then we can navigate in a reversed path by clicking 'back' button on the top left corner.

This "happy path" is easy to implement. But as a nature of web app, user may directly visit any "deep route" via a "deep url" and the "back" button loses its power to navigate through the reverse path:

1. User visits `https://app.example.com/settings/general/about`
2. User clicks back
3. App exits 
*Instead, we want the app to navigate to `/settings/general`*

I have managed to automatically inject the `/settings`, `/settings/general` routes when user directly visits `/settings/general/about`. The problem is these two pages and transitions associated to them show up in this process. 

I need the routing life cycles of auto injected routes, i.e. `/settings`, `/settings/general`,  to be complete to make the later `back` operation possible, but a complete routing life cycle causes the corresponding component to be rendered thus the problem occurred.

If I can mute/turn off the `<router-view>`'s rendering before the automatic injection starts and then turn it on later when the injection ends the problem would be hopefully solved.

### What does the proposed API look like?
```
router.mute()
router.unmute()
```

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Mute/Turn off <router-view> reactive rendering programatically" (#2284)

Issues.Title: router-link exact path matching (#fix 2040)
Issues.Body:
There have been at least two requests (#2040 and #2193) for adding ability to match only the path in a router-link.

A use case is highlighted in the issue #2040. Sometimes you want to highlight a router-link regardless of the query string parameters. This happens e.g. with paginated listing pages, where the desired page number is often supplied as a query string parameter.

This pull requests implements the requested feature.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "router-link exact path matching (#fix 2040)" (#2278)

Issues.Title: Getter with payload
Issues.Body:
### What problem does this feature solve?
I think there are already many issues for this, I just want to say this feature is very very very important, I know that perhaps we can use a mutation to do the same work just with a `return`. But mutation is for change the state, if I use it like this, I will be doing something too strange that I don't want really want to do.

I hope really Vuex getters can have a payload.

Last question, I think there maybe also a design problem with the name getter. In fact, if a getter return directlly the state, then we can change the state use this getter. It's strange because it's just a getter not getter&&setter.

I hope really someone can fix the two problems, for a long time I think I can work with these problems exist.....it's not true now......



### What does the proposed API look like?
1. getter can have a payload
2. getter cant change directly the state

Issues.Title: High CPU usage in strict mode with a large state
Issues.Body:
### Version
3.0.1

### Reproduction link
[https://jsbin.com/xetolobaba/edit?html,output](https://jsbin.com/xetolobaba/edit?html,output)

### Steps to reproduce
* Have a Vuex store with a large state (ex: thousands of reactive values)
* Activate strict mode
* Trigger any store mutation

### What is expected?
The mutation should complete in a few ms, like in non-strict mode.

### What is actually happening?
The mutation can take a very long time. It seems that vuex is iterating over the whole store at each `commit`.

---
Each store `commit` is really costly, even if they are all done at once (synchronously).

This is reproductible in any browser. For example, the example shows ~= 150ms in Chrome and ~= 250ms in Firefox.
This is reproductible in previous Vuex versions as well (2.3).

Related issues: https://github.com/vuejs/vuex/issues/1139 https://github.com/vuejs/vuex/issues/659

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "High CPU usage in strict mode with a large state" (#1338)

Issues.Title: Retrieve all modules through `_modulesNamespaceMap` in plugin
Issues.Body:
### What problem does this feature solve?
I'm writing a vuex plugin that adds one module on top of each existing module.
I tried accessing the modules in my plugin function through store._modulesNamespaceMap however, at the time the plugin triggers this seems to be still empty.

Now I have to manually look through the store's store._modules to find all modules. I came here to hope that anyone knows a better way of retrieving all modules?

Best regards,

### What does the proposed API look like?
access `store._modulesNamespaceMap` in plugin.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Retrieve all modules through `_modulesNamespaceMap` in plugin" (#1336)

Issues.Title: Retrieve all modules through `_modulesNamespaceMap` in plugin
Issues.Body:
I'm writing a vuex plugin that adds one module on top of each existing module.
I tried accessing the modules in my plugin function through `store._modulesNamespaceMap` however, at the time the plugin triggers this seems to be still empty.

Now I have to manually look through the store's `store._modules` to find all modules. I came here to hope that anyone knows a better way of retrieving all modules?

Best regards,

 * This also happens with version `2.x.x` of vuex and older versions of jest and vue.
 * This issue also happens when not using local vue.

 * [Cannot read property 'getters' of undefined](https://github.com/vuejs/vue-test-utils/issues/363)
 * [Throws "Cannot read property 'getters' of undefined" using vuex's dynamic modules](https://github.com/vuejs/vuex-router-sync/issues/46)

Issues.Title: Warn when mapGetters et. al. are used in the wrong property
Issues.Body:
### What problem does this feature solve?
I've spend couple of hours debugging an issue which caused by me mistakenly writing _mapGetters_ under _computed_ instead of under _methods_.
It would be so much helpful that the _Vuex_ code could notify the user if one of the following happens:

- _mapState_ is not under _computed_ property
- _mapGetters_ is not under _methods_ property
- _mapActions_ is not under _methods_ property
- _mapMutations_ is not under _methods_ property

### What does the proposed API look like?
n/a

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->

Issues.Title: Better error message for Vuex mapActions typo
Issues.Body:
### What problem does this feature solve?
While working using Vuex, I came across an error which took me quite a chunk of time to debug and I thought this deserves a better error messages.

While using map actions `...mapActions('select'Filter)` - notice the mistake with no square brackets in `Listings -> Filters -> SelectFilter` component. The error went up to top level component and appears as below.
```
vue.runtime.esm.js:587 [Vue warn]: Failed to resolve async component: function Listings() {
      return __webpack_require__.e/* import() */(0).then(__webpack_require__.bind(null, /*! @/pages/Listings/index.vue */ "./app/javascript/pages/Listings/index.vue"));
    }
Reason: TypeError: Cannot convert undefined or null to object
```

### What does the proposed API look like?
Show shows error message pointing to correct file and line.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
